result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Patrick George Wright Sr

records.addlTxt: Defendant Patrick George Wright in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Defendant Patrick George Wright in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea hearing. Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in to cases 21CF3598 & 21CF4404 for the purpose of sentencing.

Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court, defendant Patrick George Wright not in court, in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for .  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel requests additional status conference date.  Case adjourned, Br. 30.  Status conference scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant's Proposed Order to View Discovery, signed and filed.

Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court, defendant Patrick George Wright not in court, in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel advises Court of possible global resolution.  Case adjourned, Br. 30.  Status conference scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court, defendant Patrick George Wright not in court, in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for .  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel advises Court of possible global resolution.  Court will allow transfer of this case for global resolution only.  Case adjourned, Br. 30.  Status conference scheduled for March 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Frank M.O

Defendant Patrick George Wright in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Defendant Patrick George Wright in custody.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Patrick George Wright appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/76b667a0-98a1-69d4-e783-9185dc35fcc1  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
